abstract: Google is working with Dow Jones, Condé Nast, Sony BMG Music and other large content companies to syndicate their video content on other Web sites.
snippet: Google is working with Dow Jones, Condé Nast, Sony BMG Music and other large content companies to syndicate their video content on other Web sites.
lead_paragraph: Google built an empire delivering advertisements across the Internet, and now it plans to distribute content from media companies just as aggressively.

headline.main: Google in Content Deal With Media Companies
headline.print_headline: Google in Content Deal With Media Companies

abstract: Just as investors were receiving news of TXU‘s record-setting buyout agreement, a report has stirred up rumors about an even larger one. Shares of Dow Chemical jumped more than 5 percent on Monday, hitting a new 52-week high, after a British tabloid reported over the weekend that private equity firms might be preparing a $54 billion takeover bid for the company. Several analysts expressed doubt that any deal was in the works, but trading in Dow Chemical’s stock was extremely heavy Monday, with volume of more than triple the daily average by early afternoon.
lead_paragraph: Just as investors were receiving news of TXU‘s record-setting buyout agreement, a report has stirred up rumors about an even larger one. Shares of Dow Chemical jumped more than 5 percent on Monday, hitting a new 52-week high, after a British tabloid reported over the weekend that private equity firms might be preparing a $54 billion takeover bid for the company. Several analysts expressed doubt that any deal was in the works, but trading in Dow Chemical’s stock was extremely heavy Monday, with volume of more than triple the daily average by early afternoon.

headline.main: Dow Chemical’s Shares Surge Amid Buyout Speculation
